name: The difference between let and const

0.name: In modern JavaScript there are two ways to declare variables: let and const. Choose the correct one:
let declares a variable whose value can be changed, and const declares a variable whose value cannot be changed.

1.name: If you declare a variable with let, you can leave out the value, but if you declare a variable with const, the value is mandatory.

2.name: If you declare a variable with const without a value, it will be undefined.

3.name: If you declare a variable with let without a value, it will be undefined.

3.name: If you try to change the value of a variable declared with const, you get an error

4.name: If you do not plan to change the value of the variable, it is better to use const

5.name: A variable can be used before it is declared

6.name: A variable declared with let can be redefined up to 16 times

7.name: When you create a variable, the equals sign (=) is an assignment operator
